meanings.definition: Backgrounders: Information or details that provide context or background on a topic.
meanings.sent1: The teacher handed out backgrounders before the class discussion.
meanings.sent2: Journalists often use backgrounders to enhance their news reports.
meanings.sent3: The backgrounders were so detailed, they felt like a mini history lesson.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of the subject was like having a library of backgrounders at her disposal.
meanings.sent5: The backgrounders painted a vivid picture of the topic for the readers.

meanings.definition: Backgrounders: A person or thing that is in the background or behind the scenes.
meanings.sent1: The backgrounders quietly supported the main characters in the play.
meanings.sent2: In movies, backgrounders help create a realistic setting.
meanings.sent3: The backgrounders had a secret meeting behind the curtains.
meanings.sent4: She was like one of the backgrounders, unnoticed but essential to the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: The backgrounders added depth to the story without stealing the spotlight.

meanings.definition: Backgrounders: A type of article or document that provides background information on a news story or event.
meanings.sent1: The journalist wrote a backgrounder to give readers more context.
meanings.sent2: Before the press conference, reporters were given backgrounders to prepare.
meanings.sent3: The backgrounder was so engaging, it felt like a story on its own.
meanings.sent4: The backgrounder acted as a guiding light through the complex news story.
meanings.sent5: The backgrounder clarified the details of the event for the audience.
